intro: Terminalia cephalota, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by distinctive, woody, egg-shaped fruits. Its wood is valued for its fine grain and durability, though it is also used in traditional medicine. Terminalia cephalota plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
